Tasks.Task: Create a virtual network and virtual network gateway
Tasks.Task Description: Create a virtual network and virtual network gateway if you haven't already. This is a prerequisite for setting up an ExpressRoute connection.

Tasks.Task: Set up the connection between the virtual network gateway and ExpressRoute circuit
Tasks.Task Description: Use a Terraform script or PowerShell command to configure the connection between the virtual network gateway and your ExpressRoute circuit.
Verify your network configuration by selecting 'Get ARP Records' and 'Get route table' under the ExpressRoute Private peering page in the Azure portal.
Enable ExpressRoute Fast Path to access your Azure Large Instances servers from anywhere, including Azure VMs and on-premises.
Review Azure networking components like network security groups (NSGs) for proper connectivity and data movement. Ensure integration with private DNS zones if necessary.

Tasks.Task: Establish connectivity to Microsoft cloud services
Tasks.Task Description: Use ExpressRoute to establish connections to Microsoft cloud services such as Azure, Microsoft 365, and Dynamics 365 over a private connection.
Create and modify an ExpressRoute circuit and configure peering settings to establish the desired connectivity.
Customize your metrics and create a Connection Monitor to keep track of the performance and reliability of your ExpressRoute connection.

Tasks.Task: Evaluate network design for Synapse implementation
Tasks.Task Description: Consider connectivity design, secure connections to Synapse Studio, data exfiltration, and integration with other cloud data sources or compute engines.
Evaluate network security requirements for analytical compute and storage, including virtual networks, firewalls, and Azure ExpressRoute.
